title: Several spells of showers expected in parts of the island
byline: Several spells of showers will occur in Northern, North-central, Eastern and Uva provinces and in Matale and Nuwara-Eliya districts, says the Meteorology Department.

title: One person injured in shooting at Ahungalla
byline: One person has reportedly been injured in a shooting incident at Ahungalla Junction this morning (09).

title: At least 5 dead, over 100,000 evacuated as Los Angeles surrounded by out-of-control wildfires
byline: Raging wildfires surrounded Los Angeles on Wednesday, killing at least five people, destroying hundreds of homes and stretching firefighting resources and water supplies to the limit, as more than 100,000 people were ordered to evacuate.

title: 2025 Appropriation Bill to be presented to Parliament today
byline: The 2025 Appropriation Bill is scheduled to be presented to the Parliament today (9).

title: Three arrested over Wattegama murder
byline: Wattegama Police have arrested three suspects wanted for murder.

title: TRCSL to ban use of unregistered mobile phones?
byline: The Telecommunications Regulatory Commission of Sri Lanka (TRCSL) says that the use of communication devices including mobile phones that are not registered with the commission will be prohibited in the country in the future.

title: 10 Indian fishermen arrested for poaching in Sri Lankan waters
byline: A special operation conducted by the Sri Lanka Navy has led to the seizure of one Indian fishing boat and the apprehension of 10 Indian fishermen poaching in Sri Lankan waters.

title: Gnanasara Thero sentenced to 9 months in prison
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has sentenced the General Secretary of the Bodu Bala Sena (BBS) organization, Ven. Galagoda Aththe Gnanasara Thero, to 09 months imprisonment over his defamatory statement on the religion of Islam.

title: 2025 Appropriation Bill presented to Parliament
byline: The Appropriation Bill to allocate funds for the government expenditure in 2025 financial year has been presented to the Parliament by Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya.

title: No objection from IMF for public sector salary hike - Deputy Minister
byline: Deputy Minister of Labour Mahinda Jayasinghe stated that a considerable salary increase for public sector employees is scheduled to be carried out in the upcoming budget.

title: 2025 Appropriation Bill: Breakdown of govt expenditure by ministry
byline: The Appropriation Bill for the 2025 financial year was presented to Parliament today (09), outlining the government’s proposed expenditure for the year from January 1, 2025 to December 31, 2025.

title: Rice imports deadline to end tomorrow
byline: The deadline of the period where permission was granted for the import of rice by the private sector is scheduled to end tomorrow (10).

title: Police continue island-wide traffic operations under ‘Clean Sri Lanka’
byline: Traffic operations launched by Sri Lanka Police in line with the ‘Clean Sri Lanka’ national initiative, are continuing further across the island.

title: Two new Court of Appeal Justices sworn in
byline: Two newly appointed Court of Appeal Justices were formally sworn in before President Anura Kumara Dissanayake at the Presidential Secretariat this morning (09), the President’s Media Division (PMD) said.
